pr_title: Check bootstrapServers type before casting for kafka-clients >= 2.1

timeline.message: setup another kafka template with list

timeline.bodyText: Once you changed this, you should change the expected data yaml to map this.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: I have added more test cases for this scenario.  Pls have a check since I am not familiar with this part.
replies.author: lujiajing1126

timeline.bodyText: Why add this comment? This interceptor is used for 2.1-, isn't it?
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
Why add this comment? This interceptor is used for 2.1-, isn't it?

No. The Map argument is used from Kafka 2.1+
replies.author: lujiajing1126

replies.bodyText: But this interceptor still supports String as a parameter, I still can see the String casting.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: You didn't add any new instrumentation definition. So, this must be compatible with older releases.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
But this interceptor still supports String as a parameter, I still can see the String casting.

Exactly. Regarding bootstrap.servers, the type of the value in the map can be String or List. Both types are supported by kafka client lib.
replies.author: lujiajing1126

replies.bodyText: I am not talking about the codes. You added comment says this is for 2.1+, which is not accurate. It supports 2.1 also.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
I am not talking about the codes. You added comment says this is for 2.1+, which is not accurate. It supports 2.1 also.

So it should be ">=2.1.0", I guess?
replies.author: lujiajing1126

timeline.bodyText: Still confused what your new comments. Isn't 2.0 even 1.x client libraries using this interceptor?
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
Still confused what your new comments. Isn't 2.0 even 1.x client libraries using this interceptor?

I see. You are right. It can be used even below 2.0, if users intend to use Map type constructors.
I have removed this comment.
replies.author: lujiajing1126
